item.title: Big Bucks: L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan who wants 90-hr workweek earns ₹51cr—whopping 535x than average employee! | Today News - Mint
item.description:
L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's 90-Hour Workweek Advocacies and His ₹51 Crore Salary

Date Published: January 9, 2025

Source: Live Mint

SN Subrahmanyan, Chairman of L&T, has proposed 90-hour workweeks for employees while earning ₹51 crore annually, which is significantly higher than the average employee's salary.

This article discusses the disparity in pay between Subrahmanyan and the average employee, as well as the implications of his remarks regarding work hours.

  • Subrahmanyan's annual salary for 2023-24 is ₹51 crore, 535 times the median employee salary of ₹9.55 lakh.
  • In FY23, he earned ₹35.67 crore; in FY22, ₹61.27 crore, not including stock options.
  • L&T's employee-related expenses grew at an average of 11% from FY22 to FY24.
  • Subrahmanyan's comments have sparked significant public discussion on work-life balance.
“Dear sir, after one or two years of marriage... Family life and leisure time is as important as work life and money.” - A netizen's response regarding the 90-hour workweek proposal.

The contrast between Subrahmanyan's salary and that of L&T employees highlights ongoing discussions about executive compensation and employee welfare.

item.title: President Biden says Meta scrapping fact-checking in US is ‘really shameful’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Biden Criticizes Meta's End of Fact-Checking as Shameful

Publication Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

US President Joe Biden has condemned Meta's decision to scrap a stringent fact-checking program, stating it goes against American values.

  • Biden described the change as “really shameful” and emphasized the importance of truth.
  • The International Fact-Checking Network warns that such a policy change could cause “real-world harm” globally.
  • Meta's CEO Zuckerberg defended the decision, suggesting the program is outdated and controversially claimed it has eroded trust.
  • The United Nations and Brazil have expressed concerns, calling for regulation of harmful content on social media.
“Telling the truth matters,” said President Biden.

This controversy highlights the tension between social media policies and the impact of misinformation, drawing responses from multiple international bodies.

item.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Loses 600 Points As Airline Stocks Take Off (Live Coverage) - Investor's Business Daily
item.description:
Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Loses 600 Points As Airline Stocks Take Off

Date: January 5, 2024

Source: Investor's Business Daily

The stock market faced significant declines on Friday, driven by a strong jobs report that heightened fears of persistent inflation. Major indexes, including the Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq, closed lower, with notable performances from airline stocks.

Key Points:

  • The Dow Jones lost 1.6%, nearing 700 points, and closed below its 50-day moving average.
  • The S&P 500 dipped 1.5%, and the Nasdaq composite ended down 1.6%.
  • A robust jobs report indicated 256,000 jobs were added in December, which raised concerns about high inflation and potential Fed rate cuts.
  • Treasury yields rose, with the 10-year reaching 4.79%, its highest in over a year.
  • Airline stocks, particularly Delta Air Lines and United Airlines, soared after positive earnings reports.
  • Taiwan Semiconductor reported record revenue, defying market trends.

The California wildfires could result in losses exceeding $20 billion, according to JPMorgan.

Despite the overall market pullback, some stocks, like Delta and Taiwan Semiconductor, showed resilience, indicating sector-specific strengths amidst broader market fears.

item.title: Infosys accuses rival Cognizant of anti-competitive practices; file counter suit in Texas court - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Infosys Accuses Cognizant of Anti-Competitive Practices in Texas Court

Published Date: 10 January 2025, Source: Deccan Herald

Bengaluru: Infosys filed a counterclaim against rival Cognizant in a Texas federal court, accusing the US-based company of anti-competitive practices and poaching key executives.

  • Infosys claims Cognizant engaged in anti-competitive practices, preventing clients from working with competitors.
  • The counterclaim follows a lawsuit from Cognizant's subsidiary, TriZetto, accusing Infosys of stealing trade secrets.
  • Cognizant accused Infosys of targeting recruitment of key executives, impacting its competition.
  • Cognizant states it will take action regarding the allegations made by Infosys.
Cognizant encourages competition, but competitors cannot use Cognizant's IP to unfairly compete, as Infosys has done.

Infosys seeks triple damages for the alleged misconduct and related costs, although specific amounts have not been disclosed.

item.title: GST notices worth Rs 1.12 trillion on online gaming companies stayed - Business Standard
item.description:
Supreme Court Halts GST Notices Against Online Gaming Companies

Publication Date: Friday, Source: Not specified

The Supreme Court on Friday stayed show-cause notices on goods and services tax (GST) against online gaming companies, putting a pause on proceedings until a definitive resolution is reached.

  • The GST amount in question totals Rs 1.12 trillion.
  • The next court hearing is scheduled for March 18.
  • The dispute centers around the appropriate GST rate for online gaming—whether it should be 18% or 28%.
  • Online gaming companies advocate for a 18% tax, arguing it should be based on platform fees rather than the entire prize pool.
  • The ruling provides relief for gaming companies, preventing immediate tax coercion from authorities.
“This stay not only alleviates immediate pressure on gaming companies... allowing for legal clarity without procedural obstacles.” - Abhishek A Rastogi

Industry leaders express optimism for a fair resolution, confident it will lead to investment growth in the gaming sector.

item.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Plunges 650 Points After Jobs Report; These Leading Stocks Hit Sell Signals (Live Coverage) - Investor's Business Daily
item.description:
Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Loses 600 Points As Airline Stocks Take Off

Date: January 7, 2025

Source: Investors.com

The stock market experienced significant turmoil as the Dow Jones Industrial Average lost nearly 700 points amidst concerns over inflation and interest rates following positive job growth numbers. Airline stocks, particularly Delta Air Lines, outperformed despite the overall market decline.

Key Points:

  • The Dow Jones fell by 1.6%, closing below its 50-day moving average.
  • Job growth in December was significantly higher than expected, leading to inflation concerns.
  • Delta Air Lines shares hit an all-time high after surpassing earnings estimates.
  • The Nasdaq and S&P 500 also saw declines, with small caps suffering the most.
  • Overall market volume increased on the NYSE while decreasing on the Nasdaq.
  • Various insurance stocks faced declines due to exposure to California wildfires.
"The December jobs report indicates inflation is taking its time in getting down to the Fed's target of 2%." - Analysts

In summary, the stock market faced heavy selling pressure despite some stocks, like Delta and Taiwan Semiconductor, showing strength. Investors are closely monitoring inflation trends and the Federal Reserve's potential responses.

item.title: 'Penalise if...': MP writes to minister after L&T chairman's '90-hour' remarks - Hindustan Times
item.description:
MP Requests Action After Controversial 90-Hour Workweek Remarks by L&T Chairman

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Following remarks by L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan advocating a 90-hour workweek including Sundays, MP Raja Ram Singh has urged the Labour Minister to enforce working hour laws strictly.

  • Subrahmanyan's comments have ignited widespread outrage online.
  • MP Singh referenced esteemed business leaders promoting long workweeks.
  • He called for stringent measures to uphold labor laws protecting workers’ rights.
  • Long working hours are linked to various health issues, reducing overall productivity.
  • In a historical context, India's legal 8-hour workday has been a long-fought victory for labor rights.
“It is important to note that not only does working longer hours not ensure increased productivity, but in fact reduces productivity.” - Raja Ram Singh

This incident highlights ongoing debates about work-life balance and the enforcement of labor laws in India.

item.title: BHEL faces queries from NTPC over delays, quality in thermal projects - The Indian Express
item.description:
BHEL faces queries from NTPC over delays, quality in thermal projects

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

As India’s baseload power capacity struggles to keep pace with surging demand, top Government officials told BHEL Ltd, which manufactures and installs critical thermal power equipment such as boilers and turbines, to seek third-party consultancy services and hire “financially sound” contractors to speed up project execution.

The direction came after NTPC Ltd, India’s largest thermal power generating company that outsources commissioning to BHEL, urged “better project management” to address delays and quality issues in a September meeting, as per minutes obtained by The Indian Express under the RTI Act.

  1. BHEL faces scrutiny from NTPC over project delays and quality.
  2. Government officials recommend hiring third-party consultants.
  3. NTPC calls for improved project management practices.
“Better project management” is needed to address delays and quality issues.

The ongoing issues between BHEL and NTPC highlight challenges in India’s thermal power sector amidst growing energy demands.

item.title: Double whammy: Hotel federation FHRAI goes after Swiggy, Zomato as NRAI flags private label concerns on... - Moneycontrol
item.description:
FHRAI Challenges Swiggy and Zomato Over Private Labels in Quick Commerce

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Federation of Hotel and Restaurant Associations of India (FHRAI) is taking action against food delivery giants Swiggy and Zomato for alleged unfair practices regarding their private labels.

  • FHRAI plans to approach the Ministry of Commerce and Industry regarding quick food delivery apps.
  • The organization accuses aggregator platforms of misusing their market dominance to promote private labels like Blinkit’s Bistro and Swiggy’s Snacc.
  • They are seeking meetings with commerce officials to enforce e-commerce regulations.
  • FHRAI represents around 60,000 hotels and 500,000 restaurants across India.
“We will be requesting the implementation of the e-commerce rules and strongly argue that these quick commerce players cannot have their own private labels.” - Pradeep Shetty, Vice President of FHRAI

This initiative highlights the ongoing tension between traditional restaurants and online food delivery services in India.

item.title: Waaree Energies Share Price Target: Rs 792 cr acquisition update – BUY, SELL or HOLD stock? - ET Now
item.description:
Waaree Energies Share Price Target: Rs 792 cr acquisition update – BUY, SELL or HOLD stock?

Updated: January 10, 2025 | Source: ET NOW

Waaree Energies has announced a significant acquisition of Enel Green Power India Private Limited (EGPIPL), aiming for a 100% share acquisition valued at up to Rs 792 crores.

  • Shares had a strong debut at Rs 2,550, showing a 69.7% premium over the issue price.
  • Current share price stands at Rs 2,566.40, reflecting an 18.18% decline over the past month.
  • The acquisition is expected to enhance Waaree's operational capabilities in the renewable energy sector.
  • Brokerage firm Kotak estimates a target price of Rs 2,550 for Waaree Energies.
“EGPIPL owns solar and wind projects in India which includes approximately 640 MWAC / 760 MWDC operational and portfolio under development.”

The acquisition is poised to diversify revenue streams and bolster Waaree's growth trajectory in the renewable energy market.

item.title: Rajiv Bajaj jumps in on ‘90-hr work week' debate: 'Quality of work matters, not time' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rajiv Bajaj also said that if one wants 90-hour work week, it should start from the top.

Publication Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Amid an online outrage over Larsen & Toubro (L&T) chairperson's “90-hour work week” remarks, Bajaj Auto's managing director Rajiv Bajaj has said that the quality of work done matters much more than the hours.

In an interview with CNBC TV18, Rajiv Bajaj emphasized that if there is to be a 90-hour work week, it should originate from the leadership. He stated, "Number of hours of work doesn't matter, the quality of work does. We need a kinder, gentler world more than ever before."

Key Points:

  • Rajiv Bajaj argues that quality of work is more important than the number of hours worked.
  • Bajaj suggests that the idea of a 90-hour work week should start from company leaders.
  • He stresses the importance of work-life balance and the consequences of long working hours.
  • The controversy originated from remarks made by L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan advocating for longer work hours.
"Even if someone works 70 or 90 hours a week, their life remains interconnected with other aspects - family, health, and well-being. Ignoring this interconnectedness will come at a cost."

In conclusion, Bajaj calls for a shift away from rigid work hours towards a more flexible approach that values quality and interconnectedness in life.

item.title: Foxconn's Chinese staff barred from travelling to India iPhone factories, equipment shipments delayed: Report | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Foxconn Halts Chinese Staff Travel to India, Delays Equipment Shipments

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Rest of World

Foxconn is suspending new work rotations for its Chinese employees at Apple iPhone factories in India, leading to delays in equipment shipments. This move could disrupt iPhone assembly lines in Tamil Nadu and Karnataka.

  • Chinese workers' travel to India has been halted.
  • Equipment for iPhone manufacturing is delayed due to restrictions from the Chinese government.
  • The situation may hinder Apple's goals of advancing iPhone production in India.
  • Visa issues exacerbate the challenges, with Chinese employees being asked to cancel their trips.
“Currently, the equipment and manpower are not allowed to go over (to India)” - sources.

This development underscores the difficulties Apple faces in diversifying its production outside of China.

item.title: Cognizant CEO Ravi Kumar indulged in anticompetitive tactics and ..., says Infosys in counterclaim agains - The Times of India
item.description:
Cognizant CEO Accused of Anticompetitive Tactics by Infosys

Publication Date: (Date unavailable) Source: (Source unavailable)

Infosys has filed a counterclaim against Cognizant, accusing its CEO Ravi Kumar of engaging in anticompetitive practices.

  • Infosys alleges that Cognizant's actions have violated competition laws.
  • The counterclaim could have significant implications for both companies in the tech industry.
  • Ravi Kumar's leadership at Cognizant is now under scrutiny due to these allegations.
“Cognizant's CEO has crossed ethical boundaries in pursuit of market dominance.”

The accusations from Infosys may impact Cognizant's reputation and business operations in the market.

item.title: Surprising Dec US payrolls jump supports longer Fed pause - Reuters
item.description:
Surprising Dec US payrolls jump supports longer Fed pause

Date: Jan 10, 2025
Source: Reuters

The U.S. job growth saw an unexpected acceleration in December, leading to a reduced unemployment rate of 4.1%. This robust performance adds credibility to the Federal Reserve’s cautious stance on interest rate cuts for the coming year.

  • Nonfarm payrolls increased by 256,000 in December, surpassing expectations of 160,000.
  • The unemployment rate fell from 4.2% in November to 4.1% in December.
  • The strength of job growth is likely to influence the Federal Reserve's policy decisions on interest rates.
  • Market responses included declines in stocks and increases in bond yields.
“The outsized strength in the November employment report puts a stake in the heart of more Fed rate cuts in the first half of 2025.” - Jack McIntyre, Portfolio Manager, Brandywine Global

This employment data reflects the ongoing strength in the U.S. labor market and suggests that future decisions on interest rate adjustments will depend significantly on upcoming inflation data.

item.title: Barflex Polyfilms IPO: SME issue fully subscribed on day 1; check status, other key details | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Barflex Polyfilms IPO Fully Subscribed on Day 1

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Live Mint

The Barflex Polyfilms initial public offering (IPO) opened on January 10 and was fully subscribed on its first day.

Barflex Polyfilms IPO subscription status

The IPO was subscribed over 1.34 times on the first day, with 58,70,000 bids against 43,65,000 shares available.

  • Retail portion subscribed 2.39 times.
  • Non-institutional investors (NIIs) portion subscribed 0.69 times.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) portion remained unsubscribed.
  • IPO pricing is between ₹50 and ₹57 per share.
  • Allotment expected on January 16, 2025.
Barflex Polyfilms reported a revenue of ₹78.02 crore and a net profit of ₹13.49 crore for the period ending November 30, 2024.

Barflex Polyfilms specializes in flexible packaging materials, supporting various industries.

Almondz Financial Services Ltd is the lead manager for the IPO, which will list on NSE SME.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz G580 Edition One with EQ Technology — a bold and decisive leap for the iconic G-Class - The Hindu
item.description:
Mercedes-Benz G580 Edition One with EQ Technology — a bold and decisive leap for the iconic G-Class

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Motorscribes, The Hindu

Mercedes-Benz has reimagined the legendary G-Class with the G580 Edition One, which features an electrified powertrain, combining rugged capability with advanced technology.

  • Powered by a 116kWh battery pack, providing a range of 473 km WLTPC-certified.
  • Produces 587 horsepower and 1,164 Nm of torque, achieving 0-100 km/h in 4.7 seconds.
  • Retains classic G-Class design while incorporating modern electric features.
  • Equipped with advanced technology, including dual 12.3-inch displays and Burmester 3-D surround sound system.
  • Fast charging: recharges from 10% to 80% in 32 minutes with DC fast charger.
  • Off-road capabilities include 250mm ground clearance and a two-speed gearbox for versatility.
  • Active safety technologies ensure a secure and reliable driving experience.
The G580 with EQ Technology will debut in India as the exclusive Edition One, priced at ₹3 crore. Deliveries for the G580 will only start in Q4 2025.

The Mercedes-Benz G580 Edition One is a significant step in electrifying a classic vehicle, combining luxury and performance to set a new benchmark in the SUV segment.

item.title: SEBI proposes doubling additional-disclosure threshold for FPIs having Rs 25,000-cr exposure - Moneycontrol
item.description:
SEBI proposes doubling additional-disclosure threshold for FPIs having Rs 25,000-cr exposure

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

In a consultation paper issued on January 10, SEBI has suggested raising the bar to an AUM of Rs 50,000 crore to align with the increase in market volumes.

  • SEBI has proposed to double the additional-disclosure threshold.
  • The new threshold aims to keep pace with increasing market volumes.
  • This change is particularly relevant for Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) with existing significant exposure.
“This adjustment reflects the growing activity in the market,” SEBI states.

The proposal indicates a strategic move by SEBI to enhance transparency and governance in the growing market landscape.

item.title: What the Infosys counterclaim says about Cognizant in the TriZetto trade secrets case - Moneycontrol
item.description:
What the Infosys counterclaim says about Cognizant in the TriZetto trade secrets case

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Infosys has alleged that Cognizant's anticompetitive behaviour has significantly contributed to rising healthcare costs in America.

  • Infosys claims Cognizant's actions are detrimental to fair competition within the healthcare industry.
  • The counterclaim highlights serious implications for corporate governance and ethics in the tech sector.
  • This case is part of ongoing tensions between competing tech firms over trade secrets and competitive practices.
Cognizant is accused of fostering practices that incentivize disloyalty among employees.

The resolution of this case could have far-reaching impacts on how trade secrets are handled and the ethical considerations within competitive practices in technology and healthcare.

item.title: Decoding India’s growth slowdown - The Hindu
item.description:
Decoding India’s growth slowdown

Date & Source: January 10, 2025 - IST

The first advance estimate of India’s GDP in 2024-25 indicates a decline in the real GDP growth rate to 6.4%, down from 8.2% in the previous year. This decline highlights significant issues within the official GDP estimates and the implications of private sector investment trends.

  • The nominal GDP growth is estimated at 9.7% for 2024-25, lower than previous projections.
  • Concerns about the accuracy of GDP estimates due to reliance on the Wholesale Price Index (WPI) as a deflator.
  • Private investment continues to lag, with questions raised about the impact of corporate tax cuts on capital formation.
  • The growth in real gross fixed capital formation is projected to decline significantly.
  • The fiscal situation reflects challenges in achieving revenue and expenditure targets, raising concerns over public spending and growth sustainability.
“There is absolutely no indication of any structural break in the investment behaviour of the private corporate sector so far under the 11 years of NDA rule.” - Prasenjit Bose

The analysis of India's macroeconomic fundamentals underscores the need for a reevaluation of investment strategies and a renewed focus on achieving balanced growth amidst rising fiscal strains.

item.title: New Honda SUV Finally Launched In India! - MotorOctane
item.description:
New Honda Elevate SUV Launched in India!

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: MotorOctane

The Honda Elevate has officially been launched in India with new cosmetic updates and two limited edition models. The launch comes after Honda's absence from the Auto Expo.

  • Available in Black Edition and Signature Black Edition models.
  • Features new exterior color schemes and upgraded interiors.
  • Price for the Black edition starts from Rs 18.15 lakh.
  • Rivals include Hyundai Creta Knight Edition and Kia Seltos X-Line.
“The new Elevate Black Edition will continue to offer a 10.25-inch touchscreen system, premium leatherette upholstery, and more.”

In conclusion, the Honda Elevate's new offerings aim to enhance its sporty character and compete effectively in the SUV market in India.

item.title: Tata Nexon MY2025 Launched In India With 2 New Colour Options And 3 New Variants - CarDekho
item.description:
Tata Nexon MY2025 Launched In India With 2 New Colour Options And 3 New Variants

Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The updated Tata Nexon has been launched in India featuring two new colour options and three new variants, while the previous Fearless Purple colour has been discontinued.

  • Prices start from Rs 8 lakh (ex-showroom).
  • New colours: Grassland Beige and Royal Blue.
  • Introduced variants: Pure Plus, Creative, and Creative Plus PS.
  • No changes to exterior and interior design.
  • Maintains turbo-petrol, diesel, and CNG powertrain options.
“The Nexon continues to impress with its extensive feature list and competitive pricing.”

The MY2025 update enhances the Tata Nexon's offering, ensuring it remains a strong contender in the sub-4m SUV market.
